utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Boom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello. I’m serious and brooding Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I am friendly, accessible, ruggedly handsome Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow, Dad. Could your head get any bigger?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can you blame me? I’m accepting the Poe’s Pen career achievement award. It is the biggest honor a mystery writer can get. I am joining the pantheon of greats to whose heights I have always aspired, so …which big head?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … I like the ruggedly handsome, smiling giant you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Mmm. I like the serious, brooding giant you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. All right, Mother. You are the tie-breaker. Which of these should be hanging behind me at the ceremony next week?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Oh, darling, you know I refuse to play favorites. I love both of my son’s big heads equally. All right, I am off to meet a friend of mine whose father just passed away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, Martha, I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, no, no, no. Don’t be. He had a rich, full life. And, more importantly, he has a rent controlled loft in Chelsea. Which, if I play my cards right, could be mine. Bye.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, there’s the death-is-opportunity spirit we all love.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, looks like we have another opportunity of our own.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Let’s head out. We’ll go head-to-head later. See where I’m heading?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, with this award, you going for captain? We could be New York’s newest power couple.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, Castle, don’t jinx it. I haven’t even gotten my results back yet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s you. You aced it.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: No, man. It was the guy with the axe in his heart. He bled out in the Barcalounger. We called him lord of the flies. No?

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, no, no. You’re wrong, bro. It was the pet shop owner whose wife fed him to the dogs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you guys fighting about?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The first case that Captain Montgomery partnered us on. Ten years ago today?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? It’s your manniversary? And I didn’t get you anything.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There’s still time.

utterance.speaker: TROOPER COLLINS
utterance.content: You folks from the 12th? I’m Trooper Collins. Thanks for coming out of your jurisdiction. Our victim’s a Jane Doe. It appears she was attacked in the woods and chased onto the road where she was hit by that truck. Because of the assault we’re classifying the death as a homicide.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any idea where she was coming from?

utterance.speaker: TROOPER COLLINS
utterance.content: It’s state game land. Not a house for miles.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any idea on the body?

utterance.speaker: TROOPER COLLINS
utterance.content: No. And we ran her prints but they’re not on file. We’ve got our teams out there searching the woods, but we found these tucked into her bra.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A fifty dollar bill, key card, and a cash receipt.

utterance.speaker: TROOPER COLLINS
utterance.content: From a coffee shop in the city. Dated yesterday.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This card looks like a hotel key.

utterance.speaker: TROOPER COLLINS
utterance.content: But it’s not from anywhere around here. We think maybe she was staying in the city. We were hoping you could help us track down who she is and what she was doing here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, of course.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Trooper Collins? These carvings on her face?

utterance.speaker: TROOPER COLLINS
utterance.content: The crosses? Freaky, right? We think she was maybe running from whoever did that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They look ritualistic.

utterance.speaker: TROOPER COLLINS
utterance.content: Yeah. And it gets freakier. Just as that trucker hit the girl he says he saw something emerge from the woods.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something?

utterance.speaker: TROOPER COLLINS
utterance.content: A dark figure wearing a mask.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What kind of mask?

utterance.speaker: TROOPER COLLINS
utterance.content: He was pretty shaken, so we didn’t press. We’ll get a full statement from him once he’s been treated.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where is he?

utterance.speaker: TROOPER COLLINS
utterance.content: At the hospital in Woodburry. Excuse me. Trooper Collins. Go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We need to talk to that driver.

utterance.speaker: TRUCKER
utterance.content: I tried to stop, I did. But she just came out of nowhere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mr. Walters, the Trooper said you saw something in the woods.

utterance.speaker: TRUCKER
utterance.content: Yeah. It almost didn’t seem real, like it was some kind of ghost. Freaky as all hell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you describe it?

utterance.speaker: TRUCKER
utterance.content: It wore a dark, ragged coat. Um … with a mask, like a doll’s face.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like porcelain.

utterance.speaker: TRUCKER
utterance.content: Yeah. It was white with black where the eyes should have been.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Were there markings on it?

utterance.speaker: TRUCKER
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: TRUCKER
utterance.content: Like streaked teardrops coming from the eyes. And the face, it was, uh –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bisected with two black lines, like a cross.

utterance.speaker: TRUCKER
utterance.content: Yeah. How did you know that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was real.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was real?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, I’ve seen that mask before.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sketches from the truck driver. You ready to talk about it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was eleven years old. Uh … my mother was touring with Pippin. I was in New Hampshire, staying with the family of a classmate for President’s Day weekend. Their home abutted a few hundred acres of state forest called Hollander’s Woods. We were told never to go into the woods alone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Somebody told you not to so you had to do it anyway.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I walked for hours. I was cold, completely lost, and that’s when I saw him. A figure clad in black, kneeling. And after a few moments he left and that’s when I saw her on the ground.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A body. The first body I ever saw. He throat had been slit and those same symbols were carved into her forehead and her cheeks. I touched her arm. I remember thinking how cold it was.

utterance.speaker: MASKED ASSAILANT
utterance.content: Tell anyone what you’ve seen here today and I’ll find you and kill you. Do you understand?

utterance.speaker: MASKED ASSAILANT
utterance.content: Go!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why do you think he let you live?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. I waited until I got back to the city to call the police. From a payphone. I was too scared to let them know who I was.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And who was the girl?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s just the thing. They searched the woods with cadaver dogs. They never found a body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you never figured out who she was?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I checked local papers. No one in the area had been reported missing. When I got older I checked with missing persons, even the FBI database, for anyone matching her description, or any crimes involving those symbols or that mask, but there was nothing. It’s like it never happened. And after a while I just … started to wonder if it had. That day in the woods, Kate, that’s why I do what I do. I’m driven to figure out the story because – – I could never figure out that one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why didn’t you ever tell me this before?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I didn’t want it to be real. But it is real. He’s real. He killed before and he just tried to kill again.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I checked with the police department near Hollander’s Woods. Their logs do show that they received a call in February of ’83 reporting a body. But after coming up empty they assumed it was a prank.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, what about the FBI database?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: There’s been no other occurrences in the past thirty years of any assaults or murders with this MO. Beckett, this thing that Castle says happened … it was decades ago. Is he really sure about this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: As sure as I’ve ever seen him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, our Jane Doe? Anything on that coffee shop receipt?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, a barista there remembered seeing our victim. She wasn’t a regular there but she’d been in several times in the past few days.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was anyone with her?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. She came in alone, she’d get her drink, take a seat, and spend hours staring out the window.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, why don’t we set up a canvass of the neighborhood. Maybe somebody there knows who she is.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: After all these years do you really think it could be the same killer?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We won’t know until we find him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. That key card that we found on the victim? It was tracked to an extended stay motel out in Queens.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She paid cash for the room, didn’t present an ID. Registered as Jane Smith. Not her real name, I’m guessing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we still don’t know who she is. Did she have a car when she checked in?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. A cab dropped her off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means someone took her to those woods.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How long had she been staying here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: About two weeks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo, check the drawers. See if we can find anything to ID our victim.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Photos? All of the same woman?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And look at this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: License plate numbers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hundreds of them. Along with the registered address of each of them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would she have that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look at the numbers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Each one has the letters X and Z in it. Our victim’s looking for someone specific.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but who?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I think I know someone we can ask.

utterance.speaker: FRANK MALLOY
utterance.content: I knew something bad would happen to Emma. I was trying to find her, to stop her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Malloy, what was your daughter doing in the city?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Two months ago a friend of hers disappeared. Emma was trying to find her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait – – was this her friend?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Yeah. Zoey Addison.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what exactly do you mean by ‘she disappeared’?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Zoey had a boyfriend who was beating on her. So she took his car and was on her way to stay with Emma, but she never showed. A couple days later the cops found the car by the side of the road with a busted radiator. But no sign of Zoey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did they talk to the boyfriend?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Well, yeah. He was two states away with an alibi. He reported the car stolen, so the cops just figured that Zoey was on the run and ditched it for another ride. But Emma knew that Zoey wouldn’t do that. Not without calling. So Emma took a leave from her cashier’s job to try to find her. Retracing her route, Emma found a waitress at a truck stop who saw Zoey get into the back of a white sedan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: With New York plates containing the letters X and Z?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Yeah. The waitress told Emma it had an oval sticker in its back window that said NYC.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s what she was doing in the city. She was trying to track the car Zoey got into. Mr. Malloy, do these woods mean anything to you? Is there any reason that Emma would be in them?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Were they on Zoey’s route, maybe? Somewhere near where she disappeared?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: No, Zoey was coming from Pittsburgh. The opposite direction.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And all this time no one’s heard anything from her?

utterance.speaker: FRANK
utterance.content: Zoey didn’t have family. And if it wasn’t for Emma no one would have even known she disappeared.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s why I could never find the girl I found in the woods. He targets people who won’t be missed. Hitchhikers, stranded motorists. He asks them a couple of questions. If they fit the profile, he kills them. And if not, he’s just some good Samaritan giving them a ride. That’s why he didn’t kill me. It would have attracted attention. Thirty years. How many times do you think he did this? Ten? Twenty? A hundred? I should have found a way to stop him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you were eleven years old. And what happened to you back then was terrible, and I know that you’re thinking of this case as a way to exorcise those demons, but we don’t know what we have here. We don’t even know if this is the same person.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course it’s the same person. Emma must have been able to do what I never could. She tracked him down. That’s why he went after her. I have to find this guy, Kate. I need to end this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Guys, is there any way to check police records from thirty years ago? See if there were any abandoned cars ticketed within a fifty mile radius of Hollander’s Woods?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sure. We just have to call all municipal police departments in the area –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And wait for them to stop laughing long enough to beg them to check their dusty storage rooms – – you’re serious?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We need to know exactly what we’re dealing with, here, so … happy manniversay.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: Detective Beckett? A word?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Close the door.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I just got a call from 1PP. They want me to take you off shift tonight for a performance review.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, sir, my review’s not scheduled for another three months. Do you think this has something to do with the captain’s exam?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: No, they don’t ask for a meet to discuss exam results. They notify you by mail.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I don’t know. And none of my sources are talking, but they want you there at 7:30.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe it’s good news. Maybe you’re getting an award, too. A career achievement in homicide.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, okay, it’s probably not that. But still, it could be good news.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, why is my cop sense telling me it’s bad?

utterance.speaker: TORY ELLIS
utterance.content: Hey, guys. Got something.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: I was running those license plates on Emma’s lists, seeing if any of the owners have criminal backgrounds, when I noticed this car registered to an address right down the street from the coffee shop where Emma went the day that she was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She was surveilling that car.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She must have thought it was the one that Zoey got into at the truck stop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And when the owner of the car realized she was onto him, he went after her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whose car is it?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: That’s the weird thing. It belongs to this woman.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Connie Lewis.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: But she’s 72 and has no criminal record.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s her address?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There it is. White sedan. X and Z in the plate. NYC sticker in the window. Exactly as Emma’s witness described.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but how’s a 72 year old woman connected to all this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: After all these years we finally get some answers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Lewis? NYPD.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s open. TV’s on. Mrs. Lewis? Can you hear me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Lewis?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Lewis? Mrs. Lewis? Mrs. Lewis?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: There were no outward signs of trauma or carvings in her skin, but until I get her back to the morgue we can’t rule out homicide.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How long has she been dead?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Based on decay I’d say about three years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did no one notice?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The killer did and he used her car.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And maybe her place.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Beckett. Look what I found in the kitchen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The same matchbook that we found in Emma’s hotel room.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If Emma was tailing the killer she could have followed him there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I tracked down Lewis’s next of kin. Only family listed is a son. I found this number for him in her things.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: 910 area code? Where’s that from?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: North Carolina.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. I’ll handle the notification, see what he knows.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not much, if he hasn’t seen her in three years. What kind of son doesn’t check on his own mother?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not all families get along. My father didn’t talk to his brother for twenty years –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s empty.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Check for the phone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s been moved.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You inside, drop your weapon!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s a hole in the floor. You guys, he’s below us. Let’s go!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Noah Lewis, 52. He did a stint in the army back in the 90s. There’s no recent record of employment. He told the neighbors that his mother was bedridden and that he was taking care of her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So they just assumed he was the good son.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but the relationship was far from rosy. Four years ago his mother had him committed to a state mental institution after he threatened her with a knife. So I got in touch with the state-appointed shrink who was treating him. He says that Noah has borderline personality disorder and exhibited violent tendencies.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So it’s him? Any record of where he was thirty years ago?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, we’re a little bit more focused on where he is now. We have teams still combing the neighborhood. We put out a BOLO but so far nothing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Your theory about the killer’s MO may have just paid off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You found something?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. From February of ’83. The day after you saw that body police ticketed an abandoned pickup truck they saw by the roadside near Hollander’s Woods. The truck belonged to a farmer who loaned it to a young woman, a migrant worker, to go out and make a supply run. When the cops told the farmer that they found his truck he assumed that she’s just run off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he never reported her missing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. He didn’t want to get her in trouble with immigration.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did he remember who she was?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. And he had her photo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was her name?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Rosalita Cambeau.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’ll dig deeper into Noah, see if we can connect him to that area thirty years ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ll find him, Castle. I promise. Uh … I’m supposed to head off to my review. Do you want me to postpone?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … no, I should go with you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll be all right. I’ll call you when I’m done, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey. Are you busy? I can –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I was just … um, reading something I wrote a long time ago.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, how old were you when you knew?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Knew what?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That you wanted to be a writer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Since I was a kid, I guess. Why?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m finishing my junior year and I have no idea what I want to do. By the time you were my age you’d already published your first book and now you’re winning this amazing award because you followed your passion. How can I be amazing if I can’t find mine?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Trust me. You will. Or … or it’ll find you. And one day you will look back and you will realize that every experience you’ve ever had, every seeming mistake or blind alley, was actually a straight line to who you were meant to be. And whatever you become, there is no question in my mind you are going to be amazing. And you know how I know?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because you already are.

utterance.speaker: ADMINISTRATIVE AIDE
utterance.content: They’re ready for you, Detective.

utterance.speaker: KEITH KAUFMAN
utterance.content: Take a seat.

utterance.speaker: KAUFMAN
utterance.content: So, Detective Beckett. It says here you took the captain’s exam.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, sir.

utterance.speaker: KAUFMAN
utterance.content: What makes you think you’re qualified to be captain?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: My experience in the 12th Precinct has made me comfortable in a leadership position and at this point –

utterance.speaker: KAUFMAN
utterance.content: What I mean is, what makes you think you’re even qualified to be an NYPD detective?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir?

utterance.speaker: KAUFMAN
utterance.content: Your job is to enforce the law, yet you have repeatedly ignored it. In Los Angeles you investigated a case outside your legal jurisdiction.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But –

utterance.speaker: KAUFMAN
utterance.content: You used your badge to pursue a personal vendetta against Senator Bracken, crossing the line and endangering the lives of others numerous times.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, that man was a murderer.

utterance.speaker: KAUFMAN
utterance.content: You've withheld case information from superiors and flown in the face of authority whenever it suits you. Not to mention your working relationship with Richard Castle. Tell me, Detective, how often have you let your personal feelings for your husband dictate your actions in pursuit of a suspect?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, that is unfair. I never let –

utterance.speaker: KAUFMAN
utterance.content: When he went missing you used your position and a great deal of the taxpayers' money to search for him, enlisting the aid of fellow detectives and, well, you are infamous for being the inspiration for the fictional NYPD detective Nikki Heat, who spends more time on her back than she does pursuing killers.

utterance.speaker: KAUFMAN
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, how do you expect to lead, or even continue in your current job, when it’s clear you’ve exercised such poor judgment?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, if you were looking at my record –

utterance.speaker: KAUFMAN
utterance.content: We are looking at your record! You are not qualified for captaincy and in my opinion, you are not qualified to be a detective.

utterance.speaker: KAUFMAN
utterance.content: Thank you. You can go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re wrong, sir.

utterance.speaker: KAUFMAN
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I said, you’re wrong. In every case you have referenced I have not only successfully brought the killer to justice I have done so with the utmost respect for the law and for the department I represent. And regarding my relationship with Mr. Castle, he has proven to be a brilliant partner and he’s always had my back. And as for his fictional representation of me, I’m proud to have been his inspiration and I am proud to be his wife. You asked, how do I expect to lead? By continuing to fight for what’s right, not for what’s easy. My job is to protect the citizens of New York and I will do it by doing my job better than anyone else and getting results. I don’t cross the line. I put myself on it. And if you have any other questions then you can ask the families of the victims that I have served.

utterance.speaker: PAUL GIBNEY
utterance.content: Detective Beckett? Sit down.

utterance.speaker: GIBNEY
utterance.content: That was an impassioned and powerful response. In fact, it was exactly what we were hoping for.

utterance.speaker: KAUFMAN
utterance.content: This wasn’t a performance review.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then why would you attack me like that?

utterance.speaker: KAUFMAN
utterance.content: We wanted to see if you could defend yourself. Kate, this was an audition.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: GIBNEY
utterance.content: Your future. We’ve been looking for someone like you. Someone who isn’t corruptible. A certifiable hero who the people can get behind. Kate, you’re bigger than what you’re doing now. You know it. It’s why you went to DC, why you took the captain’s exam. You want a bigger stage and we want to give it to you. We think you have an amazing future.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Doing what?

utterance.speaker: KAUFMAN
utterance.content: We’d like you to run for New York State Senate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: State senator?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And they say it’s just the start. Apparently the party has had their eye on me for a while now. They think that people are looking for someone like me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what do you think?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, Castle. I’m a cop. I’m not a politician. Did I even tell you I was in Model U.N. when I was a kid?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: My mom was one of the chaperones and after watching me she said, “You know, Katie, you can grow up and be anything you want.” I just wanted to be her. I just wanted to make a difference.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you have. Question now is, can you make a bigger difference?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, if you saw the way that they attacked me in that room? And in a campaign it would only be worse. You, Alexis, my dad, Martha. You guys would all be fair game.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re a tough bunch.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you think I could do it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know you can.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They said that I aced my captain’s exam. I could probably have my own precinct within the year.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When do you have to decide?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Soon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, whatever you decide, I will back your play.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That matchbook lead paid off. The unit that we put on that bar spotted Noah Lewis heading inside. ESU just took him down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They found him.

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: Where’s my mother?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Being autopsied.

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: I warned her. But she wouldn’t stop running her mouth at me. Now she doesn’t say a word. It’s what she deserved.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about the others? Did they deserve what they got? We know what you’ve done, Noah. Who you really are.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tell us about Emma Malloy.

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: I’m not good with names.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you the night before last?

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: Out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Out where? Neighbors said your car was gone.

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: I took a drive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you drive to the woods? Or what about this girl? Zoey Addison.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She was seen getting into your car, Noah. Now she’s gone.

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: Mmm. She’s pretty.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is she dead?

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: I can’t help you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where do you take them? The others. How do you make them disappear?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We have your car, Noah. Your house. We will find evidence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did Emma find evidence? Is that why you went after her? Because she got too close? Is that why you shot at us?

utterance.speaker: NOAH
utterance.content: You were in my house! Don’t you see? I’m the victim here. I’m the victim.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just … he’s been getting away with it for thirty years. I thought he’s be more … vulnerable.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We have a problem. I just spoke with CSU. So far they haven’t found anything in the house or the car that links Noah to Emma or Zoey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So we can’t connect him to either of their murders?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about his mother’s?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Autopsy results indicate that she died of natural causes.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Right now, all we have this guy on is mishandling a body.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He shot at us.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but he was hiding in the closet at the time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He can claim he didn’t know we were cops. He can plead out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle, we can’t even link this guy to Hollander’s Woods. In ’83 he was at a military academy all the way in South Carolina.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was President’s Day weekend. He could have been on vacation, or – or just skipping school.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Except those records are gone, so there’s no way to prove it. All a jury’s going to hear is that he was a thousand miles away from New Hampshire. Without evidence we don’t have a case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The key to this is Emma. We need to place his car in the area at the time she was attacked. Let’s coordinate with Collins and set up a canvass up there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s gotta be a place he goes. Somewhere out of the way where he puts the bodies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You said that he was seeing a shrink?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, a uh … a Dr. Van Holtzman.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, maybe Noah said something during a session that could help us. Where do we find Holtzman?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If Noah ends up walking you’re going to have to have me committed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me, we need to speak with Dr. Holtzman, please.

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: Of course. Just a moment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen, if after seven years of your crazy theories you haven’t already been committed, then I think you’re pretty safe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m Detective Beckett, this is Richard Castle. We need to speak with you regarding one of your patients, Noah Lewis.

utterance.speaker: HOLTZMAN
utterance.content: Of course. Let me just finish with these prescriptions and I’ll be right with you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, I know that voice. From that day in Hollander’s Woods. It’s him. He’s the killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, that was over thirty years ago. You can’t possibly –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate, when he spoke I could feel the knife at my throat. I will never forget that voice as long as I live.

utterance.speaker: HOLTZMAN
utterance.content: Sorry about that. Shall we talk in my office?

utterance.speaker: HOLTZMAN
utterance.content: Please, have a seat. I wish I could say that I was surprised to hear what Noah had done but he was very troubled. We did everything we could for him while he was in our care.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dr. Holtzman, how long have you been treating Mr. Lewis?

utterance.speaker: HOLTZMAN
utterance.content: Four years. We got him stable after his mother committed him, but the condition of his release were state mandated sessions every month.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what did the two of you talk about?

utterance.speaker: HOLTZMAN
utterance.content: Anger, intimacy, his animosity towards women.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You went to Dartmouth.

utterance.speaker: HOLTZMAN
utterance.content: Yes. For undergrad.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … when was the last time you saw Mr. Lewis?

utterance.speaker: HOLTZMAN
utterance.content: A few days ago. He was quite agitated. He thought someone was following him. I thought he was just being paranoid so I adjusted his meds.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you had no idea that he was about to do something violent?

utterance.speaker: HOLTZMAN
utterance.content: None.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s done this before, you know. Abducted women, killed them in the woods. Possibly for years.

utterance.speaker: HOLTZMAN
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Witnesses. When he does it he wears a mask. Now, why would he do that, wear a mask when he kills them?

utterance.speaker: HOLTZMAN
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If you had to guess. What kind of psychosis would drive a man to do that? Something … terrible in his childhood?

utterance.speaker: HOLTZMAN
utterance.content: The mind of a psychopath is not that simple.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But he kills them anyway. So why would he need to hide his face behind this?

utterance.speaker: HOLTZMAN
utterance.content: Maybe he’s not hiding it. Maybe this is his true face. The monster he knows he really is, and he wants his victims to see it and fear it before they die. Maybe his real mask is the man he has to pretend to be every day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: His voice. I know, it sounds crazy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Because it is, Castle. We already have a suspect.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, but the perfect suspect. Because Dr. Holtzman knew intimate details about his patients. He set Noah up to take the fall just in case anyone got onto the murders. And Holtzman was in New Hampshire, at Dartmouth, in 1983.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s a family man. Married to his wife for twenty-four years. Kids. Well respected. Never been arrested.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And witnesses. They saw the victim get into Noah’s car, not Holtzman’s.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – can't explain that yet, but Holtzman is behind this. And …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Babe, the voice – is it possible you’re misremembering? You’ve made this killer your personal boogeyman. You said so yourself, you wanted him to be more formidable.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don’t believe me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s clean. He has no connection to this case. We’ve got nothing to go on.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Less than nothing. All we have is a thirty year old voice ID from a witness who was a kid at the time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, Castle, we want to solve it as much as you do –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what? I expected this from these guys. Just … not from you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry. You said it was him. I believe you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Except you’re right. There’s nothing we can do. We’d have to sit on him for years hoping he makes a move. This is not how the story was supposed to end.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I was thinking, how did he make those victims disappear without a trace?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, he would’ve had to have taken them somewhere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Somewhere his family didn’t know about.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’d have to have had a lair. A storage space somewhere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Too many things could go wrong. There could be a flood, a nosy manager. He would have to find a place over which he had absolute control, so I did a property search. It came up empty on him, but I did find this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Farmland?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Owned by Holtzman’s parents. Both deceased. It’s listed in a trust. Holtzman is listed as the sole trustee. It’s possible his wife doesn’t know about it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s only a few miles from where Emma was hit by that truck.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tax records show that there’s a barn on the property.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He must have held her there. It’s private, in the middle of nowhere, the perfect lonely place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Only I would never get a warrant. And if I searched it without one, then any evidence I would find would be inadmissible.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because you’re a cop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But … you’re not. It would be trespassing. You would be breaking the law. But if you found something… And I know how much this means to you, so whatever you decide I will back your play.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Looks deserted.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is the property line. You should stay back here on this side.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, but you’re not going in alone. Keep me on speaker. Let me know what you find.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what do you see?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like he uses it for storage. Creepy, creepy storage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, he has the same car that Noah has. Same color, same license plate, same sticker, everything. That’s how he did it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So if someone spotted him it would lead right back to Noah. But you’re going to need more than that to call the police. Look around. He may have kept trophies from his victims.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh God.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle? Castle, what do you see now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I see them. Photos of his victims. I see all of them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, he’s here. He’s inside.

utterance.speaker: HOLTZMAN
utterance.content: How did you find me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve been looking for you since Hollander’s Woods.

utterance.speaker: HOLTZMAN
utterance.content: The boy. That was you? I should have killed you when I had the chance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You can’t win, Holtzman. We know who you are.

utterance.speaker: HOLTZMAN
utterance.content: It doesn’t matter. You’ll both be dead and they’ll never find me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle! It’s locked!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle! I can’t get in!

utterance.speaker: HOLTZMAN
utterance.content: The danger of facing your demon is that sometimes your demons win.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what’s going on in there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: God! Oh, God. Are you okay? Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: NEWSCASTER
utterance.content: Still more gruesome discoveries and many more questions at the rural property of noted psychologist Van Holtzman as authorities continue to find the buried bodies of his victims.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I thought you were practicing your speech for tonight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, I was. I just, um … I couldn’t help but wonder, if it wasn’t for him, for that day in the woods, would I even be here? Would we be here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Babe, we’re not here because of him. We’re here because of who we are in the face of people like him. That’s why you write mysteries, that’s why I became a cop. We’re both trying to bring justice to this world. Now – – I’m going to go and get dressed so I can be very proud tonight of who you are.

utterance.speaker: MICHAEL CONNELLY
utterance.content: Murder. Mystery. The macabre. Tonight’s honoree has mastered them all. For years he’s kept his readers under his spell with his electrifying prose. I’m very proud to present this year’s recipient of the Poe’s Pen Career Achievement award, my good friend, Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Michael Connelly, everyone. Thank you very much, Michael. And um … my thanks to all of you for this honor. You know, I’ve spent a lot of time the last few days thinking about how I got here. The long hours, the blank pages. Most people think that writing is a solitary profession, that we spend our days in our imaginary worlds, fighting, loving, dying, but we don’t do it alone. Because anything that’s good in our writing comes from truth and the truth is I’m here because of the people in my life. Mother, you will always be a star in my eyes. And Alexis, you amaze me every day. You two are my red-headed pillars of unconditional love. To my friends at the twelfth precinct, you let me in. Especially you two, Javier, Kevin. You’ve made me your brother in arms and I thank you for that. And Kate. Seven years ago I thought I would never write again and then you walked in the door and my whole world changed. You were right, you said I had no idea. But now I do. This is because of you, because of us. Always.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: That was a lovely speech, darling.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, well – – I was inspired.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle, who’s going to be your inspiration if Beckett becomes state senator?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah, you won’t be able to follow her around anymore.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know. Maybe I’ll write a political thriller next.

utterance.speaker: JENNY RYAN
utterance.content: Ooh, I would so read that.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Beckett, if you do run I’ll help with your campaign.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: It’s a pretty big step, Kate. Have you decided what you’re going to do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not yet, but whatever it is I’m looking forward to the adventure.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: One thing’s for sure: things are going to change.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I know one thing that’ll never change. What we all have. A toast. To us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s the precinct. There’s been a murder.
